title.native: ジョジョの奇妙な冒険 黄金の風
title.romaji: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken: Ougon no Kaze

description:
The fifth story arc of the long-running JoJo's Bizarre Adventure series.

Giorno Giovanna, a young man living in Naples, has the blood of DIO -- the eternal enemy of the Joestar clan -- running in his veins. Giorno becomes a delinquent due to being persecuted since childhood. However, he's led back onto the right path thanks to a gangster who saved him and taught him to believe in others. Bizarrely enough, this gang of people who didn't forget honor, gratitude, and respect made him reform. This is how Giorno came to admire gangsters. In the backstreets of Italy, Giorno causes trouble alongside his gang "Passione," and ends up being targeted...

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Le Bizzarre Avventure Di GioGio: Vento Aureo

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Mafia
tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Criminal Organization
tags.description: Prominently features a group of people who commit crimes for illicit or violent purposes.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Time Loop
tags.description: A character is stuck in a repetitive cycle that they are attempting to break out of. This is distinct from a manipulating time of their own choice.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

node.description:
Hirohiko Araki is a manga artist. He left school before graduation from Miyagi University of Education.  

Araki is best known for his long-running series JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, published in Weekly Shonen Jump starting in 1987. The story is full of references to Western music and Italy, both of which Araki is reportedly very fond. Many of Araki's creations have been translated and released in Europe but so far only JoJo's Bizarre Adventure and Baoh have been released in the United States. One popular theory is that Araki's frequent references to Western music may violate American copyright laws. Viz has eluded much of this problem in JoJo's Bizarre Adventure by replacing some band references with album or song references, which do not appear to be as strictly guarded. Araki is a recipient of the Tezuka Award.   

(Source: JoJo's Bizarre Encyclopedia)
She was nicknamed "Yasuko Nyan" by her godfather Naomi Takebe, a producer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation).
[Website](http://www.yugokanno.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yugokanno)
Originating from [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/namachu)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岩浪美和) | [Twitter](https://x.com/i/user/169097071)

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.
Houtani Yukitoshi (宝谷幸稔) is a Japanese animator, animation director, illustrator and character designer.

[Profile](https://asahi-pro.co.jp/creator/yamada-kazuhiro)

Affiliated with Asahi Production.

_Note: Not to be confused with the other [composite artist](https://anilist.co/staff/252146/) by the same name._

Jodeci is an American R&B quartet with members DeVanté Swing, Mr. Dalvin, K-Ci, and JoJo.
Enigma is a German musical project founded in 1990 by Romanian-German musician and producer Michael Cretu.

He works for Warner Entertainment Japan. Previously a long-time employee of Geneon Universal, being a part of the company since Geneon was still known as Pioneer LDC. Note: Not to be confused with the CG animator Akihiro Kawamura (川村晃弘)
